poem:
### M&S Plea

In aisles of morning light,  
a storefront breathes—  
cyber ghosts whispering  
through locked circuits.

Feet on polished tile,  
the rhythm of day and night—  
fingertips brush cotton,  
linen unfolds under touch.

In the quiet, voices rise,  
coins clinking  
in the pockets  
of those who wander,  
seeking solace  
among the shelves.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "M&S boss urges shoppers to visit stores in person as it battles cyber-attack The boss of Marks & Spencer has urged customers to come into its stores to shop in person this bank holiday weekend as the retailer works “day and night” to tackle the cyber-attack that has crippled its online operation. The retailer’s IT systems were hit by a major ransomware attack almost two weeks ago. It is still not taking online orders, and". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
